item.title: Report X-2023080166
item.description:
Report X-2023080166

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered after dispatch , a visual on package it is damaged due to internal leaking causing the leak to seep out to the exterior of the fiberboard box DescribePack: damage is caused due to insufficient amount of packaging material for transport. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: once the damage hazmat was discovered , the hazmat was placed into a salvage drum to contain the damage and leak from further leakage to near by packages.

item.title: Report X-2023080148
item.description:
Report X-2023080148

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE VANLINE AND MANAGER TOLD QA IT WAS WET. IT WAS PUT ONTO A PALLET AND THEN INTO NON-HAZ BAG. DescribePack: EXTERIOR OF THE PACKAGE WAS DAMP. FROM WHAT APPEARS TO BE AN INTERNAL LEAK. HOWEVER THERE ARE NO BREAKS OR TEARS ON THE BODY OF PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE IS STILL INTACT JUST DAMP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: AFTER PUTTING ON GLOVES AND HAVING IT IN A NON-HAZ BAG IT WAS THEN PLACED INTO ANOTHER ONE AFTER FINDING OUT WHAT IT WAS. THEN QA PUT IT INTO A LINED BIN.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Managers called in a spill in unload upon arrived noticed package was leaking quickly assessed the incident by wearing ppe equipment to prevent injury, put down absorbent to mitigate spill put package in tote to prevent further spill took package to QA to process package. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbent was used to mitigate spill, put package in tote

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was wet on the outer surface of the exterior box , and was taken away from the discovery site in a plastic lined container .Excess liquid was sopped up using neutral absorbent materials . DescribePack: The caps on two of the bottles were easily turned using the fingers. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was sopped up using neutral absorbent materials and the rest of the shipment was removed and placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.title: Report E-2023070948
item.description:
Report E-2023070948

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: TULARE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 24, 2023 at 1305 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Tulare, California regarding the release of approximately (1) pound of AZTEC 4.67G (UN2783, 6.1 III) from (1) plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to the cap being loose and popping off during load shift, and was contained to the inside of the trailer only. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum and was taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070938
item.description:
Report E-2023070938

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Environmental (AE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. AE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the concrete and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. Once all free product was collected, crews utilized a power washer to further remediate the surface and collected the rinsate in a vac-truck. All methylene chloride impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and transported to the RLC terminal to be added to the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023070937
item.description:
Report E-2023070937

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: RANCHO CUCAMONGA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023, at 1620 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Rancho Cucamonga, California regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of Sodium Hydroxide (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 275-gallon IBC tote. Upon arrival contractors reported the release was due to a loose lid. Contractors cleaned up the release with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

AFTER USING ZEP ZORBENT TO ABSORB THE SPILLED CONTENTS, THE DAMAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070362
item.description:
Report X-2023070362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: VAN NUYS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS DUE TO THE OUTER BOX HAVING FROST FORMING AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION FOUND SEVERAL POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING CVT SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM POUCHES. PERISHABLE, RUSH, UP ARROWS, AND ULINE INSULATED SHIPPER MARKINGS ARE PREPRINTED ON THE OUTER BOX. KEEP FROZEN IS HANDWRITTEN ON THE TOP AND SIDES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE CUSTOMER OF THE UPS STORE SHOWING ON THE OUTER BOX IS JOE NICCHI.

THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 473E72, JUVENA THERAPEUTICS, INC., 2627 HANOVER ST., PALO ALTO CA 94304.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was found on the floor of the unload and brought over for inspection. The box was opened by QA and bottles of bathroom cleaner were identified and subsequently placed into a hazmat bin. DescribePack: Three bottles had their caps come off and had leaked over halfway for each bottle. item.title: Report I-2023060118
item.description:
Report I-2023060118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-14
  • City: BRADLEY INTERNATIONAL
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Delta Air Lines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/14/2023, during the meal delivery phase of the flight, a passenger seated in 16E entered the forward (FWD) galley with a smoking e-cigarette. The device was hot to the touch. The passenger notified the Flight Attendant that the device would not stop smoking. The Flight Attendant proceeded to place the device in to a cup of water. The device was then placed in a fire containment bag with two large bottles of water. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No injuries were reported.

item.title: Report E-2023070201
item.description:
Report E-2023070201

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: Los angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the screening for AWB 9021-4213, the screener found undeclared lithium batteries in 5 of the boxes. Shipper was contacted and the remaining pieces moved, while the 5 pieces are being held in the DG holding area.

item.title: Report X-2023061320
item.description:
Report X-2023061320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: LONG BEACH
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA Hazardous Materials Inspectors were inspecting containers in the ICTF Ramp. They came across SNEU 600102 and reported two of eight swing bolts were in the down position and a strong odor on top of the container. Upon further inspection of the container, all 8 swing bolts were loose. The swing bolts were secured stopping the vapor release.
